node.title: U.S. special ops raid in Syria said to leave several dead
node.description: The dead reportedly included civilians. There was no word on who was targeted but the part of Syria where the raid was conducted is home to several top al Qaeda leaders.

node.title: Serko travel software firm lowers full-year revenue guidance
node.description: Travel software company Serko is lowering its revenue expectations following the disruptions to global business travel caused by the rapid spread of the Omicron variant.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 147 new community cases in NZ today
node.description: There are 147 new cases of Covid-19 in the community and 44 at the border today, the Ministry of Health is reporting.

node.title: Covid-19: Experts give stamp of approval to border re-opening plan
node.description: Covid-19 experts have given their stamp of approval to the government's staged border re-opening plan but say one of its weak points is how self isolation and testing is managed.

node.title: Businesses should prepare for increased regulatory, enforcement action in 2022

node.title: Jamieson explains why he opted out of IPL payday

node.title: Police name Gisborne toddler who died from critical injuries

node.title: 'Massive pressure': Farmers fume over long-running labour shortage as harvest looms
node.description: It's known as the breadbasket of New Zealand, but Mid Canterbury is facing a worker burnout to complete this year's harvest.

node.title: Closed border could risk Australia becoming 'pariah' in international community

node.title: Ex-Navy captain pleads guilty in massive bribery case

node.title: Young Kiwi golfer moving on after cancellation of NZ Open
node.description: Up and coming New Zealand golfer Nick Voke is making the most of his chances abroad following the cancellation of the New Zealand Open.

node.title: Beijing Winter Olympics will be 'safe and splendid'
node.description: The Beijing Winter Olympics, officially opening on Friday, will be streamlined, safe and splendid, Chinese President Xi Jinping has assured the international sports community.

node.title: Research reveals stark differences in salaries for migrant workers

node.title: Afghans still stranded despite court ruling allowing them into NZ

node.title: Human remains found on Canterbury's Leithfield Beach identified

node.title: CBS meteorologist brings adorable baby on-air for winter storm forecast

node.title: NZ athlete who tested positive for Covid-19 now testing negative

node.title: Tough schedule for Phoenix men this month

node.title: International Space Station to crash into the Pacific Ocean in 2031, NASA says

node.title: Scientists working on single test to detect risk of four cancers in women

node.title: Plans to replace two Hamilton schools with new one

node.title: Democrats Break With Leaders Over Congressional Stock Trading

node.title: EU moves to label nuclear and gas as sustainable

node.description: The state is the 37th in the nation to establish a medical marijuana program, according to the National Conference of State Legislatures​.

node.title: Meta stock plummets after weak earnings report

node.title: Royal souvenirs have 'Platinum Jubbly' misprint
node.description: A spelling mistake on thousands of pieces of Platinum Jubilee merchandising, calling it the "Platinum Jubbly", is proving a challenge for souvenir sellers.
